description:
## Overview
[github.com/nats-io/nats-server/v2/server](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/nats-io/nats-server/v2/server?tab=doc) is an A simple, secure and performant communications system for digital systems, services and devices.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Authentication. The revocation check uses current time instead of jwt issue time.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/nats-io/nats-server/v2/server` to version 2.1.9 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/nats-io/nats-server/commit/1e08b67f08e18cd844dce833a265aaa72500a12f)
title: Improper Authentication

description:
## Overview
[github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent/structs](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul) is a tool for service discovery and configuration.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insecure Permissions. Consul fails to enforce changes to legacy ACL token rules due to non-propagation to secondary data centers.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent/structs` to version 1.6.6, 1.7.4 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Changelog 1.6.6](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/blob/v1.6.6/CHANGELOG.md)
- [GitHub Changelog 1.7.4](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/blob/v1.7.4/CHANGELOG.md)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/commit/98eea08d3ba1b220a14cf6eedf3b6b07ae2795d7)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/issues/5606)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/pull/8047)
title: Insecure Permissions

description:
## Overview
[github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver?tab=overview) is a module of Concourse CI/CD automation system.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Open Redirect. It allows redirects to untrusted websites in its login flow. A remote unauthenticated attacker could convince a user to click on a link using the OAuth redirect link with an untrusted website and gain access to that users access token in Concourse. (This issue is similar to, but distinct from, CVE-2018-15798.)
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/concourse/concourse/skymarshal/skyserver` to version 5.2.8, 5.5.10, 5.7.2, 5.8.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/concourse/concourse/commit/d058b7cca60a393abdea90fed38a0c6714256e4f)
- [Pivotal Security Advisory](https://pivotal.io/security/cve-2020-5409)
- [VMWare Vulnerability Report](https://tanzu.vmware.com/security/cve-2018-15798)
title: Open Redirect

description:
## Overview
[github.com/shiyanhui/dht](https://github.com/shiyanhui/dht) is a package dht implements the bittorrent dht protocol.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). Within the `handleRequest()` function, several unchecked type assertions are made to the values of the parsed bencoded UDP packet. 

It is possible for a illegal packet that contains a bencode integer instead of a string in the id field to trigger a panic because the type assertion is not checked and `recover()` is not used.  As such, it is possible to crash a process running by sending a malicious package.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `github.com/shiyanhui/dht`.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/shiyanhui/dht/issues/57)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/go-gorm/gorm](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm) is an ORM library for Golang.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to SQL Injection in `First` and `Find` arguments.
## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/go-gorm/gorm` to version 0.2.0 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm/issues/2517)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm/pull/2519)
- [Go-Gorm GitHub Commit](https://github.com/go-gorm/gorm/pull/2519/commits/e3cc5ea4d403078a370e299629da56cd011b6583)
title: SQL Injection

description:
## Overview
Affected versions of [`github.com/heketi/heketi/apps/glusterfs`](https://github.com/heketi/heketi) are vulnerable to Information Exposure, where the heketi.json configuration file was world readable. An attacker having local access to the Heketi server could read plain-text passwords from the heketi.json file.

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/heketi/heketi/apps/glusterfs` to version 5.0.1 or higher.

## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/heketi/heketi/commit/787bae461b23003a4daa4d1d639016a754cf6b00)
- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/heketi/heketi/releases/tag/v5.0.1)
title: Information Exposure

description:
## Overview
[go-gitea/gitea](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea) is a self-hosted git service.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to  Remote Code Execution due to not properly validating session IDs. This is related to session ID handling in the go-macaron/session code for Macaron.

## Remediation
Upgrade `go-gitea/gitea to version 1.5.2 or higher.

## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/commit/aeb5655c25053bdcd7eee94ea37df88468374162)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/issues/5140)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/5177)
title: Remote Code Execution

description:
## Overview
[github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent](https://www.consul.io/) is a distributed, highly available, and data center aware solution to connect and configure applications across dynamic, distributed infrastructure.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS). The package included an HTTP API (introduced in 1.2.0) and DNS (introduced in 1.4.3) caching feature that was vulnerable to denial of service.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/hashicorp/consul/agent` to version 1.6.6, 1.7.4 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Changelog 1.6.3](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/blob/v1.6.6/CHANGELOG.md)
- [GitHub  Changelog 1.7.4](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/blob/v1.7.4/CHANGELOG.md)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/commit/72f92ae7ca4cabc1dc3069362a9b64ef46941432)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/hashicorp/consul/pull/8023)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview
[github.com/antchfx/xmlquery](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/antchfx/xmlquery?tab=doc) is a package to extract data from XML documents using XPath expression.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) via `xmlquery.(*Node).InnerText`. The LoadURL function allows all response types/formats to be parsed (other than XML), so that it can proceed to the next process without validation.

## Details

Denial of Service (DoS) describes a family of attacks, all aimed at making a system inaccessible to its intended and legitimate users.

Unlike other vulnerabilities, DoS attacks usually do not aim at breaching security. Rather, they are focused on making websites and services unavailable to genuine users resulting in downtime.

One popular Denial of Service vulnerability is DDoS (a Distributed Denial of Service), an attack that attempts to clog network pipes to the system by generating a large volume of traffic from many machines.

When it comes to open source libraries, DoS vulnerabilities allow attackers to trigger such a crash or crippling of the service by using a flaw either in the application code or from the use of open source libraries.

Two common types of DoS vulnerabilities:

* High CPU/Memory Consumption- An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to take a disproportionate amount of time to process. For example, [commons-fileupload:commons-fileupload](SNYK-JAVA-COMMONSFILEUPLOAD-30082).

* Crash - An attacker sending crafted requests that could cause the system to crash. For Example,  [npm `ws` package](https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:ws:20171108)

## Remediation
Upgrade `github.com/antchfx/xmlquery` to version 1.3.1 or higher.
## References
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/antchfx/xmlquery/commit/5648b2f39e8d5d3fc903c45a4f1274829df71821)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/antchfx/xmlquery/issues/39)
- [Vulnerable Code](https://github.com/antchfx/xmlquery/blob/64ca73d0e0da75a116e3b7a9d6eb6c493e8a0836/node.go#L50-L62)
title: Denial of Service (DoS)

description:
## Overview

[k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/volume/cephfs](https://godoc.org/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/volume/cephfs) is a package that contains the internal representation of Ceph file system (CephFS) volumes.


Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Credential Exposure.
The Kubernetes kube-controller-manager is vulnerable to a credential leakage via error messages in mount failure logs and events for AzureFile and CephFS volumes.

## Remediation

Upgrade `k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/volume/cephfs` to version 1.18.0 or higher.


## References

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/88684/commits/3784438b566ea3f6dd2d3424150abbfe1e9fd3a1)

- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/88684/commits/548b297a0037e4f51811796da51af628f28757a5)

- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/88684)
title: Credential Exposure
